alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 12:31AM PST until December 06 at 2:48PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. .The Nisqually River near National has crested and will continue to recede Wednesday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nisqually River near National. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8,000.0 cfs, the Nisqually River will flood roads and pasture lands along the upper reaches of the river from Mt Rainier National Park downstream to Alder Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM PST Wednesday the flow was 9,400.0 cfs. - Flood flow is 8,000.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 AM PST Wednesday was 10,400 cfs around 6 PM Tuesday. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 845 AM PST.
